meanings.definition: To place in a new or different position.
meanings.sent1: I will resituate the vase on the table.
meanings.sent2: She decided to resituate the furniture in the living room.
meanings.sent3: Trying to resituate a cat is like herding cats!
meanings.sent4: After the storm, the landscape was resituated with fallen trees everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle pieces needed to be resituated to complete the picture.

meanings.definition: To relocate or move to a different place.
meanings.sent1: The company will resituate its headquarters to a bigger city.
meanings.sent2: They plan to resituate the playground closer to the school.
meanings.sent3: The ants decided to resituate their anthill next to the picnic area.
meanings.sent4: The idea resituated itself in her mind, growing stronger with each passing day.
meanings.sent5: The nomadic tribe would resituate their camp whenever resources ran low.
